episodes.author: Broadway Bullet Podcast
episodes.summary: Our out-of-this-world NYMF coverage continues with music, performance and interviews with the musicals, "The Last Starfighter", "The Boy in the Bathroom", "Emma" and "The Yellow Wood". Also, theatre news and more!

episodes.seriesTitle: Broadway Bullet: Theatre from Broadway, Off-Broadway and beyond.
episodes.title: Vol 129 - Bonus - NYMF pt. 5
episodes.author: Broadway Bullet Podcast
episodes.summary: An extra episode of NYMF Coverage! Music and interviews from the musicals, "Like Love", "Die Hard: The Puppet Musical" and "Going Down Swinging."

episodes.seriesTitle: Broadway Bullet: Theatre from Broadway, Off-Broadway and beyond.
episodes.title: Vol 129 - Sept. 20, 2007 - NYMF pt. 5
episodes.author: Broadway Bullet Podcast
episodes.summary: NYMF Coverage part 5.  Nymf-o-mania with interviews, performances and music from four musicals including "The Good Fight", "Back Home", "Sherlock Holmes: The Early Years", and "Love Kills". Don't miss our bonus episode with three more musicals!

episodes.seriesTitle: Broadway Bullet: Theatre from Broadway, Off-Broadway and beyond.
episodes.title: Vol 128 - Sept 13, 2007 - NYMF pt. 4
episodes.author: Broadway Bullet Podcast
episodes.summary: Comprehensive NYMF coverage continues with performances, interviews and music from the musicals "Love Sucks", "Bernice Bobs her Mullet", "Petite Rouge", "Unlock'd, and "Jungle Queen Debutant." Also "On the Positive Side", Theatre news and more!

episodes.seriesTitle: Broadway Bullet: Theatre from Broadway, Off-Broadway and beyond.
episodes.title: Vol 127 - Bonus - Matthew Morrison, Les Miserable & more
episodes.author: Broadway Bullet Podcast
episodes.summary: Tony Nominee Matthew Morrison and choreographer AC Ciulla discuss their careers and the Chess Benefit Concert in LA, Drew Sarich discusses being the "Best Valjean Ever" in Les Miserables and we hear from the new play, "You May Go Now" in an episode of interviews OTHER than NYMF!

episodes.seriesTitle: Broadway Bullet: Theatre from Broadway, Off-Broadway and beyond.
episodes.title: Vol 127 - Sept 6, 2007 - NYMF pt. 3
episodes.author: Broadway Bullet Podcast
episodes.summary: NYMF Coverage Part 3 as we hear interviews, songs and live performances from the musicals, "Tully", "Sympathy Jones", "The Family Fiorelli:, "Virtuosa" and "The Brain From Planet X" Also, On the Positive Side, News and more!

episodes.seriesTitle: Broadway Bullet: Theatre from Broadway, Off-Broadway and beyond.
episodes.title: Vol 126 - Aug 29, 2007 - NYMF pt. 2
episodes.author: Broadway Bullet Podcast
episodes.summary: More NYMF coverage with interviews, songs and live performances from the new musicals, "I See London, I See France", "Such Good Friends", "Austentatious", "Freshly Tossed", and  "Cousins Grimm".

episodes.seriesTitle: Broadway Bullet: Theatre from Broadway, Off-Broadway and beyond.
episodes.title: Vol 125 - Aug. 22 - NYMF pt. 1
episodes.author: Broadway Bullet Podcast
episodes.summary: NYMF Coverage begins with Executive Director, Kris Stewart, stopping by for a chat, and we have interviews with the NYMF Musicals, "Cutman", "The Beastly Bombing", and "The Kids Left, The Dog Died, Now What?" And we hear demos from all three shows. Also, Marty Cooper discusses the various incarnations of Grease!

episodes.seriesTitle: Broadway Bullet: Theatre from Broadway, Off-Broadway and beyond.
episodes.title: Vol 124 - Aug 16, 2007 - Walmartopia & more
episodes.author: Broadway Bullet Podcast
episodes.summary: The musicals, Walmartopia, Slammer, and Triumphant Baby, as well as the plays, Fair Game, and Animals all make a stop for interviews. John Delamar reviews the book, Let's Put on a Show, and more, in our one-year anniversary episode!

episodes.seriesTitle: Broadway Bullet: Theatre from Broadway, Off-Broadway and beyond.
episodes.title: Vol 123 - Aug 9, 2007 - Legally Blonde, Stephanie Block & more
episodes.author: Broadway Bullet Podcast
episodes.summary:
Legally Blonde stars, Kate Shindle and Richard H. Blake stop by and we hear "Legally Blonde Remix" and "Serious" from the Original Cast Recording released just recently.  

Also, we hear from 2006  Helen Hayes Award winner for Best Actress, Stephanie J. Block! Known for her portrayal as Liza Minelli in The Boy from Oz, she most recently starred as Grace O' Malley in Pirate Queen, which closed Jun. 17. 

Exclusive Premier of Broadway Abridged Live version of A Chorus Line. Plus more!

episodes.seriesTitle: Broadway Bullet: Theatre from Broadway, Off-Broadway and beyond.
episodes.title: Vol 122 - Aug 2, 2007 - NY Fringe Special
episodes.author: Broadway Bullet Podcast
episodes.summary: NYC Fringe Special! The musicals, Piaf-Love Conquers All and Williamsburg! the Musical stop by for an interview and in-studio performances. We also hear from the children's musical, Angela's Flying Bed, and the plays, Stock Home, Days and Nights and Roxy Font.

episodes.seriesTitle: Broadway Bullet: Theatre from Broadway, Off-Broadway and beyond.
episodes.title: Vol 121 - Jul 26, 2007 - My First Time & more
episodes.author: Broadway Bullet Podcast
episodes.summary: The musical, 33 to Nothing, stops by for an interview and two exclusive in-studio performances, The full cast of the new play, My First Time comes in for interviews and monologues, Paul Ryan talks about his book, The Art of Comedy, a capella group The Bridge performs "We have One to Watch with Omri Schein," and more!

episodes.seriesTitle: Broadway Bullet: Theatre from Broadway, Off-Broadway and beyond.
episodes.title: Vol 120 - Jul 19, 2007 - People vs. Mona & more
episodes.author: Broadway Bullet Podcast
episodes.summary: Welcome back! Three musicals stop by for exclusive in-studio performances! This week we meet with Idol the Musical, and we will hear two songs from the show. We talk to The People vs. Mona, and hear a few songs from that show. Also with us are Broken Watch Productions with Two Thirds Home. And Mod performs two songs for us before heading over to the Edinburgh fringe.

episodes.seriesTitle: Broadway Bullet: Theatre from Broadway, Off-Broadway and beyond.
episodes.title: Vol 119 - Jun 14, 2007 - Wicked, Julia Murney, Broadway Abridged & more
episodes.author: Broadway Bullet Podcast
episodes.summary: Julia Murney, currently starring in the Broadway smash Wicked, kicks off our season finale. We also play two songs from her CD: I'm Not Waiting. We chat with producer Adam Epstein, profile the new musical Sessions and hear two exclusive in-studio performances. Exclusive Premiere! Broadway Abridged Live version of Wicked. Plus more!

episodes.seriesTitle: Broadway Bullet: Theatre from Broadway, Off-Broadway and beyond.
episodes.title: Vol. 118 - Jun 7, 2007 - Four Tony Nominees Interviewed
episodes.author: Broadway Bullet Podcast
episodes.summary: This week we have a super Tony Nominee special! We talk to Orfeh and hear the full song of  "Ireland" from Legally Blonde. We talk to David Pittu of LoveMusik. We hear from Kevin Adams, nominated for lighting design for Spring Awakening, and Anna Louizos, nominated for set design for High Fidelity. Plus, Tony Nominated music from  Curtains, Grey Gardens, Fantasia on the Tonys and more!

episodes.seriesTitle: Broadway Bullet: Theatre from Broadway, Off-Broadway and beyond.
episodes.title: Vol 117 - May 31, 2007 - Radio Golf, Spelling Bee & more
episodes.author: Broadway Bullet Podcast
episodes.summary: Vol 117 - May 31, 2007 - Radio Golf, Spelling Bee & more by Broadway Bullet Podcast

episodes.seriesTitle: Broadway Bullet: Theatre from Broadway, Off-Broadway and beyond.
episodes.title: Vol 116 - May 24, 2007 - High Fidelity, Don't Quit Your Night Job & more
episodes.author: Broadway Bullet Podcast
episodes.summary: Steve Rosen and David Rossmer riff on their creation, "Don't Quit Your Night Job." We go behind the scenes at the recording of "High Fidelity," and hear two full songs from the CD. We profile the shows "Rosebud" and "Facing East." Marty discusses Evita, Top of the Trades and more!

episodes.seriesTitle: Broadway Bullet: Theatre from Broadway, Off-Broadway and beyond.
episodes.title: Vol 115 - 2007 Tony Nominee Press ClusterF%^K
episodes.author: Broadway Bullet Podcast
episodes.summary: Interviews with 23 Tony Nominees from 13 shows: Audra MacDonald. Christopher Plummer, David Hyde-Pierce, Duncan Sheik, Steven Sater Bill T. Jones, Gavin Lee, Laura Bell Bundy, Liev Schreiber, Orfeh, Raul Esparza, Charlotte D'Amboise, Debra Monk, Karen Ziemba, Steven Sater, Rebeka Luker, Jerry Mitchell, Julie White, Larry O'Keefe, Nell Benjamin, Douglas Carter Bean, John Earl Jokes, Scott Frankel, Michael Korie and Dana Ivey FROM A Chorus Line, Curtains, Spring Awakening, Mary Poppins, Legally Blonde, The Little Dog Laughed, Radio Golf, Grey Gardens, Butley, 110 in the Shade, Inherit the Wind, Talk Radio and Company!

episodes.seriesTitle: Broadway Bullet: Theatre from Broadway, Off-Broadway and beyond.
episodes.title: Vol 114 - May 10, 2007 - High Fidelity, Coram Boy & More
episodes.author: Broadway Bullet Podcast
episodes.summary: This week we talk to Amy Wilson the creator and star of "Mother Load." We also talk to actress Jenn Colella and she gives us an exclusive, in-studio performance. Two of the actresses from "Coram Boy" share their experiences on the show, also, we profile the new play "Lipstick on a Pig" with Director David Epstein. Plus, there's music, monologues, and more!

episodes.seriesTitle: Broadway Bullet: Theatre from Broadway, Off-Broadway and beyond.
episodes.title: Vol 113 - May 3, 2007 - Alex Timbers, Mary Poppins & more.
episodes.author: Broadway Bullet Podcast
episodes.summary: From Mary Poppins, we get up close with actor, Daniel Jenkins. Up Close with 3 time Tony-Winning Broadway Producer Dori Berinstein  about the new documentry "ShowBusiness." Plus, we profile the show "Dixie's Tupperware Party" directed by the (now in 2015 red-hot) Alex Timbers, and the children's shows "The New Kid" and "The People Garden." And more!

episodes.seriesTitle: Broadway Bullet: Theatre from Broadway, Off-Broadway and beyond.
episodes.title: Vol 112 - Apr 26, 2007 - Georgia Stitt, The Producers & more
episodes.author: Broadway Bullet Podcast
episodes.summary: Georgia Stitt, Vocal coach on "You're the One That I Want", shows her true colors as a songwriter talking about her new CD (and we play songs from the CD!). Also we profile the shows "American Fiesta," the musical "Time Being," and Broadway Idol winner Jaclyn Huberman's concert with exclusive in-studio performances. Plus, On the Positive Side and more.

episodes.seriesTitle: Broadway Bullet: Theatre from Broadway, Off-Broadway and beyond.
episodes.title: Vol 111 - Apr 19, 2007 - Hairspray, Paul Vogt & More
episodes.author: Broadway Bullet Podcast
episodes.summary: This week we get Up Close with Paul Vogt from "Hairspray," (and MAD TV alum) we profile the charity event Mr. Broadway (and we have a fun way for all of you to get involved), and we profile the shows "The Sea" and "The View from K Street." Also, we listen to songs from the cast recordings of "Fame Becomes Me" and "A Man of No Importance." Plus, even more!

episodes.seriesTitle: Broadway Bullet: Theatre from Broadway, Off-Broadway and beyond.
episodes.title: Vol 110 - Apr 12, 2007 - Curtains, Karen Ziemba & more
episodes.author: Broadway Bullet Podcast
episodes.summary: This week we go up close with Karen Ziemba, currently co-starring in "Curtains". We talk to Romain Fruge of "Some Men," and writer/director Rob Urbinati. We also profile the benefit "We Tell the Story: The songs of Ahrens and Flaherty", Marty Cooper gives his impressions of "Legally Blonde" and we have songs and some exclusive in-studio performances!

episodes.seriesTitle: Broadway Bullet: Theatre from Broadway, Off-Broadway and beyond.
episodes.title: Vol 109 - Apr 5, 2007 - Celia Keenan-Bloger, Summer of 42 & more
episodes.author: Broadway Bullet Podcast
episodes.summary: Tony nominee Celia Keenan-Bolger and Ryan Driscoll talk about the release of the cast recording of "Summer of '42." and we interview  the creators of the new web show "Breaking In." Plus we profile two new and different musicals: "Trophy Wife" and "The Curse of the Mystic Renaldo" Plus, exclusive song performances and more!

episodes.seriesTitle: Broadway Bullet: Theatre from Broadway, Off-Broadway and beyond.
episodes.title: Vol 108 - Mar 29, 2007 - Alan Tudyk, Anne of Green Gables & More
episodes.author: Broadway Bullet Podcast
episodes.summary: This week we interview Alan Tudyk from the Roundabout's revival of "Prelude To A Kiss." The composer and cast of "Anne of Green Gables," gives us two exclusive performances in addition to their interview. We also profile the new shows "Exits and Entrances," and "Rearviewmirror." Plus, Marty discusses Broadway by the Year in "On the Positive Side" and more!

episodes.seriesTitle: Broadway Bullet: Theatre from Broadway, Off-Broadway and beyond.
episodes.title: Vol 107 - Mar 22, 2007 - Avenue Q, Adam Rapp & more
episodes.author: Broadway Bullet Podcast
episodes.summary: Avenue Q turns 1500! We talk to Jennifer Barnhart talks about puppetry and 1500 performances of "Avenue Q". We interview playwright Adam Rapp about his new play, "Essential Self Defense". We talk to Jennifer Banhart talks about puppetry and 1500 performances of "Avenue Q," and we speak to Pablo Schreiber of "Dying City." We also profile the new play with music, "The Green Game." Plus, Marty gets banned from All That Chat and more!

episodes.seriesTitle: Broadway Bullet: Theatre from Broadway, Off-Broadway and beyond.
episodes.title: Vol 106 - Mar 15, 2007 - Big Voice: God or Merman? and more
episodes.author: Broadway Bullet Podcast
episodes.summary: This week we profile "The Big Voice: God or Merman?" and play two songs from the show. We also profile "The Rejection Show," and the Amas Musical Company (who brought along some songs from shows that are in development). Plus, we interview Ron Severini of Castle Talent and more!

episodes.seriesTitle: Broadway Bullet: Theatre from Broadway, Off-Broadway and beyond.
episodes.title: Vol 105 - Mar 8, 2007 - In the Heights, Lin-Manuel Miranda & More
episodes.author: Broadway Bullet Podcast
episodes.summary: This week we talk to Lin-Manuel Miranda and Quiara Algeria Hudes, the writers of the new musical "In the Heights" and play some songs from the show. We also profile the plays "The Sublet Experiment" and "Bill W. and Dr. Bob." Marty Cooper talks about the little-seen "Moby Dick The Musical", Plus, we help to celebrate the Oberon Theatre Ensemble's 10th season and more!

episodes.seriesTitle: Broadway Bullet: Theatre from Broadway, Off-Broadway and beyond.
episodes.title: Vol 104 - Mar 1, 2007 - Gutenberg the Musical & more
episodes.author: Broadway Bullet Podcast
episodes.summary: This week on Broadway Bullet we interview Fan-Yang of the "Gazillion Bubble Show," and introduce our new contest. Also, we interview the cast of "Gutenberg! The Musical!," the director of the new show "Blindness," and the composer of the new children's show “The Further Adventures of Uncle Wiggly: The Windblown Visitors.”  Also, we interview Frank Conway of Broadway Cares/Equity Fights AIDS.

episodes.seriesTitle: Broadway Bullet: Theatre from Broadway, Off-Broadway and beyond.
episodes.title: Vol 103 - Feb 22, 2007 - Forbidden Broadway, Adrift in Macao & more
episodes.author: Broadway Bullet Podcast
episodes.summary: This week on Broadway Bullet we interview  Christine Pedi who will be staring in "Talk Radio" with Liev Schriber. We profile the shows "The Diet Monologues" and "Adrift in Macao" including music from both shows. Plus, in On the Positive side we profile some great events that benefit BC/EFA and we preview upcoming spring musicals! Also, find out what the top stories in the theatre world are and fun events going on around town.

episodes.seriesTitle: Broadway Bullet: Theatre from Broadway, Off-Broadway and beyond.
episodes.title: Vol 102 - Feb 15, 2007 - Wedding Singer, Kevin Cahoon & more
episodes.author: Broadway Bullet Podcast
episodes.summary: This week chat with Kevin Cahoon about his new album and play the single "Fashionista" and, for all of you "Wedding Singer" fans, we play "George's Prayer."  We also profile the new play "The Last Word" and interview the shows writer and director, we discuss "Follies" at Encores! and the new musical "Tock Tick." We review the book "Creating Life on Stage" and profile the new LaMama show "La Vie Noir" and more!

episodes.seriesTitle: Broadway Bullet: Theatre from Broadway, Off-Broadway and beyond.
episodes.title: Vol 101 - Feb. 8, 2007 - Grey Gardens & More
episodes.author: Broadway Bullet Podcast
episodes.summary: Grey Gardens Exclusive! Three new songs from "Grey Gardens" are performed live in the studio and we interview Composer, Scott Frankel and actors Matt Cavanaugh and Erin Davie. Also the play, "6969", "Absolute Clarity", two songs and and interview with the creators of "Nerds! A Musical Software Satire". Marty Cooper talks about Sondheim in "On the Positive Side, we hear from the winners of the Going Geeky contest and review the book, "John Osborne".

episodes.seriesTitle: Broadway Bullet: Theatre from Broadway, Off-Broadway and beyond.
episodes.title: Vol.21 - Jan 4, 2007 - Director's Panel, Bindlestiff Cirkus & more
episodes.author: Broadway Bullet Podcast
episodes.summary: Season Finale! The play, "Once There Was a Village", Bindlestiff Family Circus, Dan O'Brien discusses playwriting, Part 2 of our director's panel. Sh-K-Boom's holiday sale and song from "Title of Show". Also, Marty Cooper gives his wish list for 2007 in "On the Positive Side".

episodes.seriesTitle: Broadway Bullet: Theatre from Broadway, Off-Broadway and beyond.
episodes.title: Vol.18 - Dec 14, 2006 - Spring Awakening, Kristin Linklater & more
episodes.author: Broadway Bullet Podcast
episodes.summary: Interview with Kristin Linklater, author of "Freeing the Natural Voice", Interview with Ken Davenport and two songs from "Altar Boyz", Interview with "Spring Awakening" director, Michael Mayer and Musical Director, Kimberly Grigsby and Marty Cooper gives his mid-season report card in "On the Positive Side".

episodes.seriesTitle: Broadway Bullet: Theatre from Broadway, Off-Broadway and beyond.
episodes.title: Vol.17 - Dec 7 - Skylar Astin, Spring Awakening & More
episodes.author: Broadway Bullet Podcast
episodes.summary: Interview with Two Time Tony Award Winner, Stephen Spinella, Going Geeky on "Spring Awakening" with Skylar Astin and more, Songs from Sheri Rene Scott, "Striking 12", and Dirty Rotten Scoundrels. Actress Vanessa Aspillaga from "The Clean House" and Marty Cooper reviews "Mary Poppins" in "On the Positive Side"

episodes.summary: Andrea Marcovicci "The Queen of Cabaret", "That Time of the Year", "Art People", "Dick Cheney's Holiday Spectacular 2006", "To Be Loved" and a review of "Spring Awakening" in "On the Positive Side".

episodes.author: Broadway Bullet Podcast
episodes.summary: Patrick Page from "The Grinch", "Piano Bar", "Floyd and Clea Under the Western Sky", "Creation Nation", "Wanda's World", Gavin Mikhail, "Gauguin-Savage Light" and "On the Positive Side".

episodes.author: Broadway Bullet Podcast
episodes.summary: "Striking 12", the new Groovelily Musical, Martha Lavey, Artistic Director for Steppenwolf, TJ and Dave and "Great Expectations". Song selections from "Piano Bar", "Simply Sondheim" and "Striking 12". Marty Cooper Discusses the 10th anniversary of "Chicago" in "On the Positive Side".

episodes.seriesTitle: Broadway Bullet: Theatre from Broadway, Off-Broadway and beyond.
episodes.title: Vol.13 - Nov 9, 2006 - Vanities, Legally Blonde & More
episodes.author: Broadway Bullet Podcast
episodes.summary: David Kirshenbaum and Leslie Kritzer discuss their Joe's Pub Gigs and the musicals, "Vanities" and "Legally Blonde". The new comedy, "The Internationalist", the experimental play, "The Whore from Ohio" and a rare Sondheim song, "Hades" from "Simply Sondheim - A 75th Birthday Salute. Also, Marty Cooper discusses critics and tryouts in "On the Positive Side".

episodes.seriesTitle: Broadway Bullet: Theatre from Broadway, Off-Broadway and beyond.
episodes.title: Vol.12 - Nov 2, 2006 - Nancy Opel, Evil Dead & More!
episodes.author: Broadway Bullet Podcast
episodes.summary: Tony Nominee Nancy Opel! The musicals Gauguin/Savage Light and Evil Dead the Musical. Nancy Opel talks about her career and her new play, "My Deah". The drama, "The Given", Playwright Dan O'Brien and Marty Cooper reviews the "Les Miserables" revival in "On the Positive Side".

episodes.seriesTitle: Broadway Bullet: Theatre from Broadway, Off-Broadway and beyond.
episodes.title: Vol 11 - Oct. 26, 2006 - Dan Fogler & More
episodes.author: Broadway Bullet Podcast
episodes.summary: Dan Fogler! Up close with Tony winner Dan Fogler as he talks about his new play, "Voyage of the Carcass", the development of "Spelling Bee" and more! We also talk with people involved with the musical "How to Save the World and Find True Love in 90 Minutes", the charity benefit, "Broadway Soul" and we play songs from "The Flood" and "Escape From Pterodactyl Island". Marty Cooper talks about shows that should have been hits in "On the Positive Side".

episodes.seriesTitle: Broadway Bullet: Theatre from Broadway, Off-Broadway and beyond.
episodes.title: Vol 10 - Oct. 19, 2006 - Donna McKechnie, Mike Daisey & More
episodes.author: Broadway Bullet Podcast
episodes.summary: Donna McKechnie! Up close with Tony Winner Donna McKechnie as she talks about her book, "Time Steps", her early career, a Chorus Line and more, we also play three songs from her. Interview and song from the musical, "The Flood". Also interviews with the shows, "Mail Order Bride" and Mike Daisey with his show "Truth". Marty Cooper talks about his desert island cast albums in "On the Positive Side".

episodes.seriesTitle: Broadway Bullet: Theatre from Broadway, Off-Broadway and beyond.
episodes.title: Vol 09 - Oct. 11, 2006 - Hunter Foster & More
episodes.author: Broadway Bullet Podcast
episodes.summary: Hunter Foster! We have an in-depth interview with Hunter Foster and play some songs he has recorded. We also interview Krista Vernoff (head writer for Grey's Anatomy) about her play, "Me, My Guitar and Don Henley". We have a report on the Australian Theatre scene and a song from "Prodigal". Also, Marty Cooper gives his review of the "A Chorus Line" revival in "On the Positive Side".
